How Israel has tried to halt the wave of recognition for the State of Palestine
Subhead: Emmanuel Macron is set to deliver his speech recognizing Palestine on September 22 at the UN headquarters in New York. In retaliation, Israel is considering closing the French consulate in Jerusalem and annexing part of the West Bank.

'Immigration must be treated as an economic and social issue, not a moral one'
Subhead: Immigration is a volatile issue in the US, the UK and France. Claiming − as some on the French left do − that the issue's magnitude is the result of political manipulation reveals a form of blindness, argues Le Monde columnist Philippe Bernard.

Title: North Korean leader recalls 'good memories' of Trump, urges US to drop denuclearization demands
Subhead: Kim Jong-un stated that he has no intention of ever resuming dialogue with rival South Korea, but that there was 'no reason not to' resume talks with the US if Washington agreed to abandon 'its delusional obsession with denuclearization.'

Title: The antique map collection is a market waiting to be rediscovered
Subhead: A rare collection of engravings by cosmographer André Thevet, including several particularly unusual sheets, is set to be auctioned in Paris on September 24. The starting price is set at €10,000, but the auction house is hoping for a bidding frenzy.

Title: 'He said he would kill me': The femicide of Inès Mecellem, a crime authorities failed to prevent
Subhead: On September 8, the young social worker was stabbed to death by her former partner. Despite five warnings and court-ordered surveillance, her attacker was never taken into custody, and he is still on the run today.

Subhead: Chinese and American film shoots and a prime minister who has made it his home base: Just an hour from Paris, this village of 460 residents draws hundreds of thousands of visitors. Yet its fame brings little benefit to the locals.

Title: Historian Tal Bruttmann's sharp eye on the Holocaust
Subhead: In his latest book, the French historian continues his investigation into the photographs taken by the SS in 1944 at Auschwitz – archives that had never been used before – and tirelessly challenges misconceptions about the Holocaust.

Title: Grenoble, Strasbourg and Rennes top France's ranking of bike-friendly cities
Subhead: After surveying thousands of riders, cycling advocates on Thursday released their ranking of France's most bike-friendly cities, aiming to shape debate ahead of the 2026 municipal elections.
